title: (x) St. Louis Browns athletic college font - (similar to) Hoboken High {Stephen}
content:
Hello,

I am trying to find a font that replicates the font (for PC) which was used to type BROWNS in the attached picture. Any help will be greatly appreciated!

Thanks a lot,  
KB

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Brownsscript.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092630/http:/typophile.com/files/Brownsscript.gif) | 11.16 KB |

 [‹ (x) Shakira website font - Endor {Mike F}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092630/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13091 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Looking for PRE-ITC Bookman with swashes - Castcraft {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092630/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12866 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sunsausage

comments.content: Do a search for Princetown (most likely Letraset thru Monotype). And mind: there’s a whole Type ID board dedicated to this...

[Princetown](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092630/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.2727.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=BROWNS&sampleSize=48) is the outlined athletic font.

[Here are some others.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092630/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/2829.html) Hoboken High is your best bet. I would write [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092630/http:/www.lineto.com/) and ask if it’s still available.
I was mistaken. [Hoboken High](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092630/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Categories/Headline+Fonts/Hoboken+High/Slab+Serif/) is still available.
